text: "Licking Stick – Licking Stick" is a song written by James Brown, Bobby Byrd, and Alfred "Pee Wee" Ellis and recorded by Brown as a two-part single in 1968.White, Cliff (1991). "Discography". In Star Time (pp. 54–59) [CD booklet]. New York: PolyGram Records.Leeds, Alan, and Harry Weinger (1991). "Star Time: Song by Song". In Star Time (pp. 46–53) [CD booklet]. New York: PolyGram Records. Byrd provides backing vocals on the song. It was the first stereo single release by King Records. The song was included on the album Say It Loud – I'm Black and I'm Proud. The title of the song refers to a stick used to administer corporal punishment (a "licking"). Brown has a history of domestic violence. ==Chart positions== {|class="wikitable sortable" !align="left"|Chart (1968) !align="center"|Peak position |- |align="left"|U.S. Billboard Hot 100 |align="center"|14 |- |align="left"|U.S. Billboard R&B; |align="center"|2 |} ==Live version== Brown performs live versions of "Licking Stick – Licking Stick" on his 1970 album Sex Machine, as well as on the 1998 release Say It Live and Loud: Live in Dallas 08.26.68. ==References== ==External links== * AllMusic review * Category:James Brown songs Category:1968 singles Category:Songs written by James Brown Category:Songs written by Bobby Byrd Category:Songs written by Alfred "Pee Wee" Ellis Category:King Records (United States) singles Category:1968 songs
title: Licking Stick – Licking Stick
